itemDescription: Royal Navy and South African Navy officer

wikipedia_page.main: Rear-Admiral Guy Waterhouse Hallifax  (21 June 1884–28 March 1941) was a South African military commander, who was recruited by the South African government to organise a navy.

response: *Writers: Andrew Bernhardt, Guy Hallifax, Christopher Lillicrap
* Guy Hallifax CMG, naval officer and founder of the Seaward Defence Force, South Africa

He became director of the Seaward Defence Force on 28 March 1941 after the death of Rear Admiral Guy Hallifax and was promoted to the rank of captain. He was promoted to acting commodore on 1 May 1946 and confirmed in that rank on 1 August 1946.
